description: Teen sleep deprivation due to digital media addiction poses risks warned by experts. Lack of sleep affects mood, focus, and immune system, leading to health issues. Schools and parents advised to address this growing concern.
title: Sleep deprivation leading to neurological disorders in teens

description: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury criticizes the flawed process of appointing election commissioners, highlighting procedural issues, lack of shortlisting, and rapid resignations, while opposing govt's influence and specific candidate nominations. Giving details of the meeting of the collegium that took place on Thursday, Chowdhury said he had no option but to be a bystander to the proceedings and registered his protest against two names proposed by govt for posts of EC.
title: Adhir Ranjan dissents & terms selection of ECs ‘formality’

description: Future Gaming, led by Santiago Martin, bought Rs 1,394 crore electoral bonds, paid Rs 6,000 crore GST. Facing ED probes, he caused Rs 910 crore loss to Sikkim govt. Detained in Vellore prison, involved in Punjab lottery scam. Future Gaming bought Rs 1,394 crore worth of electoral bonds between April 2019 and Jan 2024. The company, with its headquarters in Coimbatore, said in its annual report for 2021-22 that it had a turnover of Rs 20,000 crore.
title: Future Gaming’s Martin on ED, IT radar for 10+ yrs

description: A day after foundation stone for three semiconductors projects worth over Rs 1.2 lakh crore was laid, electronics & IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday said that five more fabs are in the pipeline. Several assembly, testing, marking and packaging (ATMP) units would be set up to create the entire value chain, ecosystem and a "very strong" semiconductor industry in India.
title: 5 more semiconductor fabs in 5 years, says Vaishnaw

description: Mamata Banerjee suffered injuries at home, treated at SSKM Hospital. Mention of a possible conspiracy. She fell and hit a cabinet edge. Support and well wishes from political figures and family members for her quick recovery. The Bengal CM was taken around 7.30pm to the hospital’s British-era Woodburn Ward, where doctors first stopped the bleeding and then closed the forehead wound with three stitches. The cut on the nose required one stitch.
title: Mamata injured in fall at home, hospital director says she was pushed

description: Paytm users will be able to continue using the app for UPI payments even after RBI's restrictions on the company's banking arm kick in from March 16.National Payments Corporation of India on Thursday authorised One97 Communications, which operates Paytm, to join UPI as a 'third-party app provider' under a multi-bank model - this move will ensure continuity for Paytm users.
title: Paytm gets nod for UPI payments via other banks
Abhay Chautala moves HC for Z-plus security

description: Citing data, Shah said population of Hindus and Sikhs had declined from 23% at the time of Partition to 3.7% in Pakistan. “Where have they gone? Not as many have come here. They were forced to convert. In Bangladesh, there were 22% Hindus in 1951. The 2011 Census returned their share as 10%. In Afghanistan, there were almost two lakh Sikhs and Hindus and now at the most 500 left. The minorities there have been persecuted and treated as second-class citizens,” he said.
title: Govt to go on front foot on CAA, ‘expose’ critics: Shah
Joining BJP today, says MP denied TMC ticket

description: The two appointments were approved by the PM-led selection committee at a meeting on Thursday afternoon, attended by home minister Amit Shah and leader of Congress in Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury as the other two members. Chowdhury put up a dissent note raising questions over the procedure for appointment of the two EC members, calling it a “mere formality” as he was given a shortlist of six candidates “just 10 minutes before the meeting”.
title: 1988 batch ex-IAS Gyanesh Kr, Sukhbir Sandhu named ECs
Oppose BJP in run-up to polls: Key kisan meet

description: Election Commission released details of Rs 12,155 crore electoral bonds from SBI, with top donors including Future Gaming, Megha Engineering, Qwiksupply Chain, Vedanta Ltd, Haldia Energy, and more major contributors. A quick analysis by TOI of the larger donors, based on EC data, shows that several groups have contributed through more than one entity. A more detailed study may show further, smaller contributions through other group entities. Also, the corporate lineage of some donors could not be reliably ascertained by the time of going to press.
title: EB bumper: ‘Lottery king’ Santiago No. 1 bond buyer
Joint polls to help restore original structure: Panel
Left releases first list of 16 LS candidates in Bengal

description: "Glad to meet my friend and PM of Bhutan @tsheringtobgay on his first overseas visit in this term. Had productive discussions encompassing various aspects of our unique and special partnership. I convey heartfelt thanks to His Majesty the King of Bhutan and @PMBhutan for inviting me to visit Bhutan next week," said Modi on X
title: PM Modi likely to visit Bhutan next week

description: ​ Initiating action in coordination with various intermediaries, ministry of information and broadcasting blocked 18 over-the-top (OTT) platforms for obscene and vulgar language content on Thursday. The ministry also blocked multiple websites, applications and social media handles of the blocked OTTs nationwide for violation of IT Act, IPC and Indecent Representation of Women (Prohibition) Act.
title: Govt bans 18 OTT platforms, 19 sites, 57 social media a/cs

description: The current astronaut training centre in Bengaluru — where India’s Fabulous-4, Group Captains Prashanth Nair, Ajit Krishnan and Angad Prathap, and Wing Commander Shubhanshu Shukla, are training — is designed to cater only to demands of the first mission under Gaganyaan and Isro will build a larger training facility. Sources now indicate that the larger facility — most likely in Devanahalli although Challakere is not ruled out yet — could accommodate 25-30 astronauts and maybe even their families.
title: After Fab 4, next round of astronaut selection may begin in 6 month
Uzbek woman found dead in B'luru hotel, hunt on for 3 suspects

description: According to UNDP’s Human Development Report 2023-24, India showed progress in reducing gender inequality, ranking 108 out of 166 countries in Gender Inequality Index (GII), as compared with 122 out of 170 nations in 2021. With a GII value of 0.437 in 2022, India fared better than the global average of 0.462 and South Asian average of 0.478.
title: India ranks 134 out of 193 nations in UNDP’s 2022 HDI
Police camps bringing change to once 'no-go areas' in C'garh

description: Road transport ministry's pilot programme in Chandigarh provides cashless treatment to road crash victims, aiming for nationwide expansion and reduced road fatalities by ensuring timely medical care during the golden hour. The ministry said the pilot programme is aimed at establishing an ecosystem for providing timely medical care to the road crash victims, including during the golden hour (first hour from accident). TOI had on Jan 31 first reported about the govt proposal to cap the amount for cashless treatment.
title: Road ministry starts pilot project on cashless treatment of victims in C'garh

description: Effective April 1, 2025, all cars must include a 'rear seat belt alarm'. Stemming from Cyrus Mistry's incident, non-compliance may result in fines. Despite the law, many rear seat passengers are unaware of this rule's enforcement. The draft notification for introduction of this crucial safety feature, aimed at nudging rear-seat passengers to wear seatbelts, has been put in public domain seeking feedback. “The notification is only for rear seatbelt alarm and there is no other new provision,” said an official.
title: Car makers to provide ‘rear seat belt alarm’ from Apr 2025

description: Assam on Thursday informed SC that Union-controlled oil and gas firms in the past 12 years have earned a cumulative net profit of over Rs 3.3 lakh crore but are unwilling to part with even 0.6% of that amount towards their tax dues to the state, chargeable on 6,639 sq km of land used by them, which is more than the size of Goa.
title: Oil and gas cos refuse to give even 0.6% of profit as tax: Assam
AAP names 8 for Punjab Lok Sabha polls

description: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Thursday announced five guarantees for farmers that the INDIA bloc will implement if the coalition comes to power.These included crop loan waiver for farmers, exclusion of farmers from the ambit of GST, minimum support price for farm produce based on the Swaminathan Commission's recommendations, framing new import/export policies keeping the interest of farmers in mind.
title: MSP, loans & GST waiver among Rahul Gandhi promises to farmers
EV makers will have to give 3-year warranty on batteries

description: States endowed with major minerals but featuring low on the prosperity index told Supreme Court on Thursday that India's economic federalism would be fractured by the Centre's vehemence in denying states their right to tax mineral-bearing lands and questioned big industrial groups - Adani, Ambani, Tata and Vedanta - for supporting the Union's stand.
title: Denial of right to tax minerals will hit eco federalism: States

description: Govt-run fuel retailers on Thursday slashed prices of petrol and diesel by Rs 2 per litre. In a separate post on X, the oil ministry said the latest reduction will "boost consumer spending and reduce operating costs for over 58 lakh heavy goods vehicles running on diesel, 6 crore cars and 27 crore two-wheelers".
title: Cut in fuel prices will boost consumer spending: Oil minister

description: Indian national, Bhandari, granted appeal against extradition by UK court. Requests relate to money laundering and tax evasion. Case forwarded to home secretary. Issues include degrading prison conditions and undisclosed assets. The Indian government has issued two requests for the extradition of Bhandari (62), an Indian national living in London.
title: Bhandari wins permission to appeal extradition in UK HC

description: A British government spokesman on Thursday confirmed that the Royal Air Force plane transporting the UK Defence Minister had its signal jammed near Russian territory this week.The incident occurred on Wednesday evening while Grant Shapps was returning from Poland, where he had attended a NATO exercise, aboard an RAF jet, according to several reports.
title: RAF carrying minister faced signal jamming near Russia: UK
Oppn: ‘1 nation,1 election’ aimed at dismantling Constitution
Paytm gets third-party app license from NPCI
Electoral bonds: Full list of donors who contributed Rs 10cr or more

description: TRP list showcases Anupamaa's reign, with intriguing storylines in Jhanak and Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin. Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai and Pandya Store also bring forth engaging plots, while Sagar Parekh reflects on his role in Anupamaa.
title: Jhanak, Taarak Mehta return: Most watched TV shows of the week

description: Petrol, diesel prices cut! In a relief for the common man, the Petroleum Ministry has announced a reduction in petrol and diesel prices across the country, effective from Friday, March 15. The new petrol and diesel prices will be applicable from 6:00 AM on March 15.
title: New petrol, diesel rates in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Chennai

description: Kolkata Knight Riders  mentor Gautam Gambhir, who rejoins the purple brigade after a two-year stint with the Lucknow Super Giants, felt Australian pacer Mitchell Starc, whom was bought for a whopping sum of Rs 24.75 crore in the last auction, will be the team’s X-factor this time. KKR will open their campaign in 2024 IPL against Sunrisers Hyderabad at home on March 23.
title: Starc to be KKR's X-factor in IPL: Gambhir
Petrol and Diesel prices reduced by Rs 2 per litre

description: With another IPL season on the horizon for MS Dhoni with the Chennai Super Kings (CSK), there's speculation surrounding whether this could mark his last campaign in the league. Following his instrumental role in leading CSK to their fifth title triumph in the previous season, Dhoni's leadership and experience continue to be indispensable for the team.
title: MS Dhoni's final IPL season? De Villiers gives a major update

description: SpaceX's Starship megarocket encountered difficulties during re-entry into Earth's atmosphere on its third test flight, as per the company's webcast. This time, the mega-rocket managed a successful liftoff from Texas, surpassing the outcomes of its previous two flights that ended in explosions shortly after launch. The Starship, the largest rocket ever constructed, soared over the Gulf of Mexico, showcasing improved performance.
title: SpaceX Starlink Starship megarocket 'lost' in final phase of test flight

description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee sustained a significant injury and was hospitalized, as announced by the Trinamool Congress. Photos shared by the party showed her in the hospital with a forehead cut and blood on her face. Mamata Banerjee's brother revealed that she fell at her Kolkata residence after attending an event. Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin expressed shock and sent his wishes for her swift recovery.
title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee suffers 'major injury,' admitted to hospital: TMC
Election Commission uploads electoral bonds data shared by SBI on its website

description: Delhi Capitals' assistant coach Amre praised Rishabh Pant's vintage form post-injury, anticipating high-scoring IPL games in Vizag. The team gears up for the March 23 opener in Mohali against Punjab Kings, stirring excitement among fans.
title: 'Didn't feel like...': Amre on Rishabh Pant's outing in nets
'6 names given, 10 mins before meet': Adhir on appointment of ECs

description: SpaceX, owned by Elon Musk, successfully conducted the third test launch of Starship, a key rocket for Nasa's lunar missions and Musk's Mars plans. The launch occurred at 8:25 am local time in southeast Texas, drawing over 1.5 million online viewers. The spacecraft was scheduled for liftoff around 8 am EDT (1200 GMT) from SpaceX's Starbase site near Boca Chica, Texas, by the Gulf of Mexico.
title: SpaceX Starship megarocket launches on third test flight

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the opposition INDIA bloc of corruption and anti-national agendas while addressing beneficiaries of the PM SVANidhi scheme in Delhi. He distributed loans to street vendors and laid the foundation stone for Delhi Metro's Phase 4 corridors. SVANidhi offers working capital loans to urban street vendors affected by Covid-19, promoting formalization and digital transactions.
title: INDIA bloc's ideology is corruption, fuelling anti-national agenda: PM

description: Playing consistently at the highest level for an extended period is an immensely challenging feat. However, MS Dhoni has been accomplishing exactly that for the Chennai Super Kings in the IPL. Dhoni is poised to lead the defending champions for the remarkable 15th season in IPL 2024, having guided the team to a record-equalling fifth title last year.
title: Watch: Why age is just a number for MS Dhoni
Paytm gets third-party app license from NPCI
'Go with your own identity now .. ': SC warns Ajit faction
10 FAQs on 'one nation, one election'
'One nation, one election': 32 parties back simultaneous polls
‘Remarkable progress’: UN hails India’s progress in HDI

description: Russia is all set to vote on March 15-17 for their next President. As per reports, the polls will be open for three days starting from Friday to Sunday. The Presidential elections will be held online for the first time. The much anticipated polls holds a vital position not only for Russia but for the world as well.
title: Russians ready to vote tomorrow, Putin set for another comeback
'In case of hung House ...': Key recommendations of panel on 'one nation, one election'

description: TCS partners with Nuuday for cloud transformation, enhancing experiences, offering hybrid cloud architecture. Vikram Sharma commits TCS support. Monika Gullin emphasizes the strategic importance of the partnership. TCS will streamline functions across application and infrastructure domains to drive business agility and scalability. TCS has a strong presence in the Nordics for 30 years.
title: TCS strikes multi-million-dollar deal with Denmark’s Nuuday

description: Congress's Kharge accused BJP of amassing Rs 400 crore via electoral bonds from 45 companies post ED, CBI raids, demanding transparency through independent investigation. State Bank of India disclosed 22,217 purchased bonds, 22,030 redeemed by parties.
title: 'BJP misused agencies to garner Rs 400 cr through electoral bonds'

description: Despite enduring a challenging spell with the bat, Ajinkya Rahane found himself beaming with joy at the Wankhede Stadium on Thursday as he led Mumbai to their 42nd Ranji Trophy title. Despite Mumbai's victory over Vidarbha by 169 runs to claim the championship, Rahane's personal performance throughout the Ranji season had been lackluster, with only 214 runs to his name, ranking him ninth among Mumbai's run-scorers.
title: 'I am the lowest...': Rahane after guiding Mumbai to Ranji title win

description: RBI extended Paytm Payments Bank restrictions deadline to March 15. NHAI removed PPBL as Fastag provider. Users need KYC for new Fastag. Refunds available for unused Paytm account balances by deadline.
title: Paytm Payments Bank deadline: How to buy new Paytm Fastag

description: Paytm Payments Bank cuts 20% of staff due to RBI deadline and compliance issues. Share price plunges 54%. Staff express frustration over layoffs despite earlier assurances. Bank adjusts staff based on appraisal cycle.
title: Paytm Payments Bank faces staff reduction: Report

description: Chennai Super Kings' dominance in the IPL isn't solely attributed to MS Dhoni's captaincy or the relaxed demeanor of his players. Bowling coach Dwayne Bravo credits their consistent success to the absence of external interference. Undoubtedly, Chennai Super Kings stand as the most steadfast team in IPL history, with numerous playoff appearances and five championship victories to their name.
title: 'Outside interference...': Bravo on CSK ahead of IPL 2024

description: Vande Bharat Express trains for global markets! Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced that ICF in Chennai will focus on developing standard gauge Vande Bharat trains for export. Standard gauge rakes, commonly used in railways worldwide, will now be a part of ICF's export strategy.
title: Vande Bharat trains to be manufactured in standard gauge for exports

description: Elon Musk terminated a show on X featuring Don Lemon due to Lemon's CNN-style approach on social media. Musk criticized Lemon's demand for special treatment and compared it to the failing CNN business model. “However, like any enterprise, we reserve the right to make decisions about our business partnerships, and after careful consideration, X decided not to enter into a commercial partnership with the show,” said the platform.
title: Elon Musk cancels show with TV host Don Lemon, here’s why

description: iFOREST study highlighted challenges of EV transition with expected obsolescence of ICE parts. Indian market to see increased EV penetration, impacting states like Haryana, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu. Anticipated job growth in passenger car manufacturing. Follow TOI Auto for updates.
title: Maharashtra, Haryana bear brunt of EV transition

description: Amit Shah applauds 'One Nation-One Election' report on Twitter. The High-Level Committee submits an extensive report to President Droupadi Murmu, proposing changes in electoral procedures and synchronization of polls, though challenges remain in the transition process.
title: 'Historic day': Amit Shah hails 'One Nation-One Election' report

description: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has emphasized the significance of Virat Kohli's form in determining Royal Challengers Bangalore's IPL playoff chances in the upcoming season. Kohli, who last played for India in January, is expected to rejoin RCB ahead of their season opener against Chennai Super Kings on March 22.
title: IPL: 'Every time Virat Kohli comes back from a break…'
Young Uzbek woman found murdered in Bengaluru hotel

description: Post office savings schemes like KVP and POMIS do not offer 80C benefits. Mahila Samman Savings Certificates offer no tax benefits. Time Deposit Account rates vary, with five-year deposits eligible for Section 80C benefits.
title: Not all post office savings schemes entail Sec 80C tax benefits

description: Mumbai won the Ranji Trophy for the 42nd time, ending an eight-year drought. The team defeated Vidarbha by 169 runs in the final. It was Mumbai's 48th appearance in the summit clash in the tournament's history. Despite a target of 538 runs, Vidarbha delayed the outcome till the final day, riding on captain Akshay Wadkar and Harsh Dubey's valiant efforts.
title: Mumbai end eight-year drought, clinch 42nd Ranji Trophy title

description: Recent increase in Dearness Allowance to 50% benefits central government employees and pensioners, with a 4% raise. The government's finances are impacted by Rs 12,868.72 crore annually, benefiting approximately 49.18 lakh employees.
title: Dearness Allowance hiked to 50%: All you need to know
Amarinder's wife Preneet Kaur, suspended by Congress, joins BJP

description: Former bureaucrats Sukhbir Singh Sandhu and Gyanesh Kumar have been named as the new election commissioners by a panel chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, committee member and Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said on Thursday. Chowdhury addressed reporters at his residence following the conclusion of the meeting, stating that six names were considered by the panel for the selection of the two election commissioners.
title: Sukbhbir Sandhu, Gyanesh Kumar appointed election commissioners: Adhir Ranjan

description: AAP unveiled 8 candidates for Punjab's Lok Sabha polls, featuring Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal, Gurmeet Singh Khudian, and Dr. Balbir Singh. Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal is set to contest from Amritsar, meanwhile Gurmeet Singh Khudian will contest from Bathinda.
title: Kuldeep, Gurmeet in AAP's candidates list of eight for Punjab

description: Musheer Khan, the brother of Indian cricketer Sarfaraz Khan, broke Sachin Tendulkar's record in the Ranji Trophy final against Vidarbha. The 19-year-old batsman scored 136 off 326 deliveries, helping Mumbai lead over 500 runs. He also became the youngest Mumbai batsman to register a century in a Ranji Trophy final, surpassing Tendulkar's previous record.
title: 'Sher Bhooka Hai...': Sarfaraz praises brother Musheer

description: Sudha Murty, 73, former chairperson of Infosys Foundation and an acclaimed author, especially for children's books, was nominated to Rajya Sabha last Friday, on International Women's Day. Murty's support of Rs 10,000 from her emergency funds kickstarted Infosys, now a behemoth with a market cap exceeding USD 80 billion. She holds the distinction of being the first female engineer at TELCO.
title: Sudha Murty takes oath as Rajya Sabha MP

description: The Supreme Court seeks NCP response to Sharad Pawar's plea on name/image misuse, with orders for timely replies and undertakings. EC's decisions on party names remain effective pending further hearings.
title: Misuse of name, pics: SC seeks reply of Ajit Pawar faction

description: Yashasvi Jaiswal's remarkable performance in the Test series against England, following a reprimand from Sunil Gavaskar, led to him scoring a record-breaking 712 runs. Jaiswal was named 'Player of the Month' by the ICC for February.
title: When Gavaskar 'mildly reprimanded' Yashasvi in hotel elevator

description: Rahul Gandhi strongly criticizes the usage of EVMs and demands ballot papers for the upcoming Lok Sabha election. He promises a caste census, economic survey, and fair representation for marginalized groups if his party comes to power.
title: People saying 'EVM hatao', but ECI not listening: Rahul Gandhi
Govt bans 18 OTT platforms, 19 websites, 10 apps

description: China's real estate sector, including Evergrande, is facing challenges with declining home sales and prices. Vanke, one of China's largest developers, faces financial strain as Moody's downgrades its credit rating to "Ba1", citing substantial credit risk.
title: Why China's property crisis could get more severe

description: Indian cricket legend Yuvraj Singh has criticized Mumbai Indians' decision to replace Rohit Sharma with Hardik Pandya as captain for the Indian Premier League 2024 season, arguing that Rohit should have been given an additional year to lead the side due to his five IPL titles and that Pandya's appointment was strategic.
title: 'Would have given...': Yuvi on Hardik replacing Rohit as MI captain

description: If the ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) in Odisha forms an alliance with the BJP, it would leave the opposition space to the Congress. This alliance may help the BJP secure over 400 seats in the upcoming Lok Sabha polls, while Naveen Patnaik aims to become the longest-serving chief minister.
title: BJP-BJD reunion in works? How will it change poll landscape in Odisha

description: The committee on 'One Nation One Election' recommends standardising electoral rolls, amending laws and Constitution, and provides a roadmap for the transition. The process will be time-consuming, requiring legislative changes after analysing the report.
title: 'One nation, one poll' report submitted to President Murmu

description: Royal Challengers Bangalore has begun their pre-tournament camp for the upcoming Indian Premier League season, under new head coach Andy Flower and Director of Cricket Mo Bobat. Despite the absence of star player Virat Kohli, skipper Faf du Plessis and West Indies fast bowler Alzarri Joseph were present. Kohli is expected to join the team soon.
title: Watch: RCB commence IPL preparations; Kohli to join soon

description: Rishabh Pant, with the support of orthopedic surgeon Dinshaw Pardiwala, believed in a miraculous recovery after a high-velocity knee dislocation following a car accident in December 2022. After a 14-month hiatus, Pant is set to make a comeback in the IPL for Delhi Capitals after extensive rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy.
title: Watch: How 'Miracle Man' Rishabh pulled off a remarkable recovery

description: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma stated the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) is significant in the state, predicting a low number of citizenship applications. Himanta has also said that he will be the first to step down if even one person, who has not applied for the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the state, gets citizenship under the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 (CAA).
title: CM Himanta says CAA 'completely insignificant' in Assam

description: India has a high prevalence of kidney stones. Renal stones are common and can lead to renal failure. Recurrence is frequent, but lifestyle changes, including diet and hydration, can help prevent it. World Kidney Day serves as a platform to educate individuals about kidney disease prevention, early detection, and treatment options, ultimately striving to reduce the burden of kidney-related ailments on a global scale
title: Why do some people develop kidney stones

description: The Union ministry of home affairs has issued a NOC to rename eight railway stations in Amethi district after local temples, saints, idols, and freedom fighters. Smriti Irani initiated the move to preserve cultural identity and heritage in Amethi Lok Sabha constituency.
title: 8 UP railway stations to be renamed after local temples, saints
Kejriwal files petition against ED summons

description: Ticketless passengers on Mumbai's local trains have prompted the formation of the 'Batman Squad', a dedicated team that conducts ticket checks at night. The squad has generated revenue, improved safety for women passengers, addressed overcrowding issues, and promoted digital ticketing methods.
title: 'Batman' watching you on Mumbai locals at night

description: In Malappuram, on Sunday at 6pm, a footballer from Ivory Coast was racially abused and assaulted during a five-a-side match. A viral video led to the footballer lodging a complaint with the Malappuram district police chief.
title: African footballer abused, beaten up during match in Kerala

description: Mizoram govt saves Rs 12.86 crore in 5 years by reducing facilities and entitlements of ministers, speaker, deputy speaker, and members of legislative assembly. Legislators no longer provided vehicles, but can avail vehicle loan. Govt officials expected to follow austerity measures.
title: Mizoram House passes 4 bills to curtail lawmakers' entitlements

description: Lakshmi, the skinniest elephant in India, rescued from abuse, is now on a 'girth watchlist' due to weight gain and arthritis. With specialized care from Wildlife SOS, her condition has improved but requires monitoring to maintain mobility.
title: India's skinniest elephant on brink of being declared overweight

description: RBI banned PPBL from accepting new deposits and top-ups after February 29. NHAI advised Paytm Payments Bank-issued Fastag users to get a new Fastag by March 15 to avoid penalties. Here’s a list of 32 banks and financial institutions authorised as Fastag providers.
title: NHAI gives Paytm Fastag users March 15 deadline to move to other banks

description: The Enforcement Directorate has issued an attachment order for Vinod Khute's flats in Dubai worth Rs 38 crore. He is being investigated for money laundering, FEMA violation, and a cheating-forgery FIR. Khute collected over Rs 400 crore from Indian investors and is the mastermind behind illegal financial activities. Previous searches resulted in the freezing of bank balances and cash.
title: ED attaches Rs 38 crore worth of flats in Dubai to Vinod Khute
Yogi Adityanath gives appointment letters to UPPSC appointees

description: The S&P BSE Small Cap Index has experienced a significant drop, declining over 12% from its peak earlier this year. Despite this downturn, many investors have seized the opportunity to purchase more shares, maintaining a positive outlook on Indian equities. This optimism is echoed by domestic institutional investors, including mutual funds and insurance companies.
title: An $80 billion question: What next for small-cap stocks?

description: Dr C N Manjunath, former Prime Minister H D Deve Gowda's son-in-law, announced as BJP candidate from Bangalore Rural constituency in Lok Sabha elections. He will be contesting against D K Suresh, the incumbent MP and brother of deputy chief minister and State Congress chief. BJP leaders Narendra Modi and Amit Shah expressed happiness about his candidacy.
title: Deve Gowda's son-in-law makes poll debut for BJP

description: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has discovered icy compounds surrounding protostars, offering insights into the chemical foundations of habitable worlds. The study suggests that complex organic molecules (COMs) are formed through solid-phase reactions on cold dust grains and can be transported to planet-forming disks via comets and asteroids.
title: Nasa’s Webb telescope finds icy ingredients in space

description: Goa police announced that tourists renting cars or bikes in the state must sign undertakings to adhere to traffic regulations. The undertakings mention regulations, fines, and punishments. Random checks will be conducted on rental operators to ensure compliance and promote tourism safety.
title: Goa: Before renting vehicles, tourists to sign pledge

description: Amit Shah, the Union home minister, stated that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) will never be taken back and dismissed claims that it is unconstitutional. He also dismissed any provision on detention camps in the Act. Shah clarified that the law does not violate Article 14 and explained that the NRC is not interconnected with CAA.
title: CAA not 'anti-Muslim', impossible to repeal it: Amit Shah

description: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar celebrated Indian team's 4-1 victory over England in the five Test series despite initial setbacks and key players' absences. He praised the emergence of young talents and their dominance over England. Gavaskar also criticized England's behavior, accusing them of a "superiority complex" and unnecessary verbal exchanges.
title: Some Eng players can't stomach IPL fees of Indians: Gavaskar
ED conducts raids in multiple locations in Sandeshkhali

description: Massive fire in a residential building in Shahstri Nagar, Shahdara, New Delhi. Nine people, including two children, rescued. Four-floor building with car-parking facility. Fire originated from parking lot. Fire officials reached the spot in narrow street and doused the flames. Rescued people sent to Hedgewar hospital after a search conducted.
title: 4 dead, including 2 kids, in Delhi building fire

description: US authorities arrested four people, including three Indian nationals, near the Canadian border in Upstate New York for attempting to enter the country unlawfully. The US Border Patrol caught them as they jumped off a moving freight train on the International Railroad Bridge in Buffalo. The three men are undergoing processing for deportation.
title: Three Indians arrested while entering US illegally from Canada

description: Financial planners recommend goal-based investing as a disciplined way to allocate money in mutual funds. This approach helps investors avoid random selections based on current trends and stay focused on achieving their goals.
title: What is goal-based investing?

description: Olivia Munn, known for movies like X-Men: Apocalypse, Ocean's 8, The Predator, opens up about being diagnosed with breast cancer in a heartfelt post on Instagram. She credits Dr. Thais Aliabadi for saving her life by calculating her Breast Cancer Risk Assessment Score. Olivia had done a genetic test and had a normal mammogram prior to the diagnosis.
title: Actor Olivia Munn reveals breast cancer diagnosis

description: Google paid $10 million in bug bounties to 632 security researchers in 2023. The highest individual reward was $113,337. Android vulnerabilities earned over $3.4 million, while Google Chrome flaws resulted in a combined payout of $2.1 million.
title: Here's how much Google paid to find 'flaws' in its products

description: Over the last 50 years, Bengaluru has witnessed a rise in built-up areas and a decline in the water spread area and vegetation. This has contributed to a severe water shortage and increased air pollution. The city's unplanned urbanization has led to various issues such as resource inequity, traffic congestion, and slum spread.
title: How unplanned urbanization led to severe water crisis in B'luru

description: The Sanyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) rally in Delhi opposes the central government's pro-corporate policies and demands debt waiver and minimum support price (MSP) for all crops. Farmers from various unions, including women's and student unions, joined the rally to protect food security and small producers.
title: Protesting farmers start for Delhi by trains and on foot

description: Delhi Police arrest Aditya Krishna, an IIT (BHU) graduate, for selling fake cancer drugs. Krishna made a substantial amount of money by selling fake injections in Bihar, Delhi-NCR, and Pune. Police raid Uttar Pradesh locations to catch suspects involved in the racket.
title: Fake cancer drugs racket: Delhi Police arrest IIT grad

description: Telangana has the highest gross enrolment ratio (GER) of Muslim students in India, with Tamil Nadu ranking second. The report indicates progress for Muslim youth, with more students pursuing higher education in commerce and arts fields.
title: This state has highest count of Muslims pursuing higher education

description: A 22-year-old woman lost her life and six others were injured in a car accident in the Ghazipur area of east Delhi. The incident occurred around 9 pm, leading to the locals vandalizing the vehicle and attacking the driver. The driver is hospitalized and under medical care. A video circulating on social media shows the angry crowd damaging the car. The accused driver is in police custody.
title: Car ploughs into crowded weekly market in Delhi, 1 dead

description: In a post on X, the San Francisco-based company said only that after careful consideration, it "decided not to enter into a commercial partnership with the show.” It added that Lemon's show “is welcome to publish its content on X, without censorship, as we believe in providing a platform for creators to scale their work and connect with new communities.”
title: Musk calls off show with former CNN anchor after 'tense' interview

description: Traffic in central and south Delhi will be severely affected due to the farmers' mahapanchayat at Ramlila Maidan. Delhi Police has granted permission with restrictions on bringing tractors, trolleys, sticks, weapons, or firecrackers.
title: Farmers' protest: Police restrict traffic in key stretches

description: In Shark Tank India 3, Amit Bhayani and Manjeet Singh pitch their chronic pain management platform using physiotherapy, yoga, and AI. Namita Thapar offers Rs 50 Lakhs for 1.32% equity and Rs 50 Lakhs debt at 12% interest. Amit and Namita come at loggerheads as both of them wanted to go solo for this deal.
title: Shark Tank 3: Amit, Namita come at loggerheads for a chronic pain management brand

description: Shreyas Iyer's recurring back injury puts his participation in IPL2024 with Kolkata Knight Riders in doubt. Iyer eceived treatment from Mumbai physio and underwent a scan. He played the Ranji Trophy final against Vidarbha. Iyer was denied the central contract by BCCI after his failure to make himself available for his state side to play domestic cricket.
title: Shreyas Iyer's back injury flares up, doubtful for IPL

description: Major League Cricket has partnered with Cognizant as the first-ever title sponsor of America's premier cricket championship, marking a significant step forward for professional cricket in the US. The league returns for its second season on July 4, featuring renowned cricketers like Rashid Khan, Faf du Plessis, Marco Jansen, Quinton de Kock, Haris Rauf, and Sunil Narine.
title: Cognizant becomes title sponsor of Major League Cricket
What happens next with TikTok?

description: Eight months ahead of the US presidential election, the campaign moves from the parties' nominating contests to the trench warfare of what promises to be one of the longest, most brutal head-to-head showdowns in memory. President Joe Biden and his predecessor Donald Trump -- the oldest pair of nominees in history -- emerged this week from a primary season that has inflicted battle scars on both, raising questions over their judgment and mental acuity.
title: Biden and Trump gird for marathon White House race
